text: - I could not form these bonds and then murder them.
- That put a fire in my belly to catch the Traitors.
- I just wanted to walk around looking cute in the castle.
- I got murdered by the Traitors.

It was the element of me
just getting more vocal around the Round Table,
and I was one of the most vocal ones left,
so that's why I think it came down to me.
I came into this game to have fun, and I came into this game to

you know, do the missions, be competitive,
but never really step on anybody's foot,
because that's not something that's cool in my books.

- Danielle and I don't care,
like I could be wrong, but I don't think I am,

I think that she is a monster,
and I had to be a monster too as a Traitor,

but she took it to a whole other level,
trying to gain sympathy from other people,
faking the tears, faking the... [shakes]

If I had to go up in that fucking turret
with her one more goddamn time and fake that, I couldn't.

I was not prepared for, like,
all of the evidence that I had against her
to be used to be flipped around on me, I wasn't.
I said, “I can't keep up with this,”
and I'm like, “Dylan, you know this,
what are you doing, why are you just standing there?”
And he just stood there.
But I didn't expect that from him.

It hurt, it felt like
here I am once again, tripping over my words,

stumbling over what I have to say
and not being able to articulate anything.
And nobody's listening, and it, ooh...
- Coming into this game, it was very difficult
to see where I was going to stand with some of these people,
because they've known each other from reality,
they've worked with each other on some other competition shows,
and they only knew of me, maybe through the media.
I like to stay private when it comes to my personal life,
and I'd like to keep the past and celebrate the past,
and I like to just be my genuine self.
And that's what really made me successful at gaining everybody's trust.

- I'm hurt because I really feel like,
like I was so close, like I could have won,
and this is like,
I don't want to be mad at myself, but I am.
In order for me to even be a Traitor and do what I was doing,
I had to, like, just completely disconnect.
It was too hard, and I could not look at certain people
and form these bonds with them and then murder them.
Oh, I just wanted to, like, walk around looking cute in a castle.

- There were a few people that I really thought were Traitors
that came out to be Faithfuls.
That just made me understand how difficult the game was.

It made me upset that they had to go,
so that put a fire in my belly to catch the Traitors.
The day that we got Boston Rob,
that day was the day that I was fully in it,
and at the Round Table, it was enough listening.
There was a lot of facts, and it was time to vote for someone,
so that was the most certain I've ever been.
That was one of my favorite days at the, in the castle.
I think some of the Traitors were definitely
Gabby and Dolores.
Okay,
the Traitors are
oh my God, Danielle.
Danielle's reactions,
her nervousness was not genuine.
One of the biggest things in acting and in real life,
when you cry, it's a vulnerable moment, so you kind of hide it.

But if you do want people to see it like a baby would,
they kind of cry out loud.
It's a form of communication.
So she was always crying out loud.
That's why it was never genuine for me.

All the other people that she was super close to,
she was really lying to them.
Desperate times call for desperate measures,
so that's what she did.
- I don't want her to win.
I wanted to bring Gabby in because I was like, I just want to have fun.
That's all I wanted to do this whole game is have fun,
but I'm working with people that just weren't.
- Wow, Carolyn.
I'm very surprised by this because she was always so genuine.
The crying wasn't there as much,
so I do think Carolyn was a better Traitor than Danielle,

but Carolyn did fly under the radar,
and no one was suspecting Carolyn.
- Maybe I would have done better as a Faithful.
No, I did great, and I'm proud of myself.

I'm proud of myself,
I didn't think that I would get this far.
This is hard, it's fucking hard,
it's harder than “Survivor.”
Boston Rob said the same thing.
First of all, I was shocked to even be here.
I'm not some “Survivor” legend.
You know what, I can have a conversation
with Boston Rob and Jeremy and Tony, and I can fit in with them too.
I belong like I, like you know what I mean?
Like, I'm a Survivor too.
I'm grateful,
I really am, like, this was amazing, it was.
- I mean, Alan picked the two most nervous people to be Traitors.

These two were so obvious
that I definitely know I'm not good at this game,
and I think the end of this season is going to be really interesting.
- We have someone here to see you.
The person after you who was banished.
- Oh, amazing.
- [knocks]
- Come over here, you Traitor.
- You already know that I'm a Traitor?
- Of course I don't.
I would have never guessed.
Okay.

- Isn't this crazy, like, as a Faithful?
- It's crazy.

- You're probably thinking,
and you probably, yes, never suspected me,
because how did you view me in the game, just be real?

- I think you were the least person I suspected, which was...
- [laughs]
- Which means I think you played it better than Danielle,
because she was not genuine.
- Like, I cried a lot, but it was, like, genuine and real,
and so when I saw
the fake tears and her...
- That was all fake?

- All fake.
- Really?
So she's here to win, and she'll do whatever it takes,
lie, cry?

I told everyone...
- In lying I get, you might need to lie sometimes.
She was basically trying to get me,

and so I needed to get her before she got me.
- Before she gets you.
- Nobody listens to me or when I speak up...
- They shouldn't believe you.

- Well, yeah!
- [laughs]
- Yeah, exactly, no...
- It was happening right in front of us.
- I know, but I'm somebody,
like, the same reasons you, like, don't suspect me of being a Traitor.

It's like when I actually needed people to, like, listen,
they're not going to listen.
Well, you were at that Round Table.

- That's why you were a good pick,
they picked a good one.
Well, was it Danielle's vote to murder me,
or was it you?
- So I had, like, kind of, didn't know if I wanted to murder you,
because you had said, like, “Danielle's next.”

- Yeah, she was.
- And I'm like, “Yes, I'll finally get somebody to be on board.”
- You should have waited one more day.
- I know,
and it's true, I thought about that.
I'm like, “Crap!”

I was getting sick of your ass.
- Yeah.
- Like, you were getting too smart, and like you were,
it was like, “Shut up.”
And then also, people, like, saw you as Faithful.

- It's not that I was getting smart,
I was just saving it for last.
- People had said you were playing the smartest game.

That's what people said at the, at breakfast when you didn't show up.
- Really?
But were they sad when I was gone?

- Yeah, of course.
- Okay.
- But you were too smart.
- Wait, did you tell Alan you wanted to be a Traitor?

- Hell yeah, I did.
- You did?
- Did you not?
- Of course not, what do you mean?
[laughs]

So...
- You literally said you didn't want to be a Traitor?
- Yeah.
- Why?
- Because I didn't want to be a Traitor.
The last two nights at the castle, you have to be really desperate,
and you have to do really desperate things.
That's why I never chose to be a Traitor.
I think for you, it would have been hard to as well.
- I needed to hear that, okay.
I needed to hear that,

because truthfully, there are things that I just know I can't do.
- Yeah.

- And I can't look people in the eyes.
- How did you sleep at night?
- Horribly.
I felt crap like, you know how bad I felt about Tony?

I was bawling my eyes out.
- Really?
If you go back, would you choose to be a Traitor or...

- Hell no, I'm a Faithful, like this is way too hard.
- So you just,

you ask me, you're like, “Why would you
tell Alan you want to be a Faithful?”

This is why.
- [laughs]
- This is why,
this is exactly why.

- Thank you, it's true.
-Yeah.

- Like it's just not me.
 - Yeah.

- It's not me.
- Yeah.
- Oh, I want to know who,
who you want to win.
- Who I want to win, Ivar.
I want Ivar to win.

- What?!
- Yes,
because listen, like from...
- You want the Lord to win?
- Yeah, of course, why not?
But who knows.
I think he's going to get really messy.
- See, he's so calm, and he's like, calming me down,
and it's like, maybe I should be like that too.
- It would be if you were a Faithful.
[laughs]
Do you have any questions for the Faithfuls?
- [sighs] Why didn't anyone listen to me?
- Because you're a Traitor.

I think if I was at that Round Table,
it would have been a different idea.
I had plans for Danielle the next day.
Her time should have been your night of banishment.
- Thank you.
- But if it didn't happen then, it's not going to happen.
Yeah.

- You shouldn't have been murdered yet, it's the truth.
- Yeah,
if you were, I don't think you were very smart with your moves.
Otherwise you would have kept me around,

and you would have, you would have had me do that
and then murder me.
Any other questions?
- [laughs]
